Making a release date is a very difficult thing as a game developer, because when you take longer than you have previously guessed when publishing the release date, you either have to do a rushed release full of bugs, or you have to delay the release. Both of which would make lots of people rage.

On the other hand, if you are taking shorter than you guessed, you still need to stick to that release date and let the community wait for something which could be released immediately if you didn't set that date.

Some people will say that they should at least give us an estimated release without any warranties, but it will still cause lots of disappointment in the community if they take longer. In fact even if you don't release any release date and the community only sees some hints, which is exactly what happened here with the steam thing, people will be really disappointed if they turn out to be wrong.
